description: an RDF library for node.js. Suitable for client and server side.
name: rdflib
readme:
# rdflib.js
[![NPM Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/rdflib.svg?style=flat)](https://npm.im/rdflib)
[![Join the chat at https://gitter.im/linkeddata/rdflib.js](https://badges.gitter.im/Join%20Chat.svg)](https://gitter.im/linkeddata/rdflib.js?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=badge)

Javascript RDF library for browsers and Node.js.

- Reads and writes RDF/XML, Turtle and N3.
- Read/Write Linked Data client, using WebDav or SPARQL/Update
- Parses RDFa
- Local API for querying a store
- Compatible with [RDFJS task force spec](https://github.com/rdfjs/representation-task-force/blob/master/interface-spec.md)
- SPARQL queries (not full SPARQL)
- Smushing of nodes from `owl:sameAs`, and `owl:{f,inverseF}unctionProperty`
- Tracks provence of triples keeps metadata (in RDF) from HTTP accesses

## Documentation

See **[Tutorial for using rdflib.js](https://github.com/solid/solid-tutorial-rdflib.js)**
for more information.

Possible out of date information is available from here:
[http://dig.csail.mit.edu/2005/ajar/ajaw/Developer.html](http://dig.csail.mit.edu/2005/ajar/ajaw/Developer.html).

## Install

```bash
npm install
```

Generate the dist directory

```bash
make all
```

#### Node.js

Make sure you have Node.js and Node Package Manager ([npm](https://npmjs.org/))
installed.

```bash
npm install --save rdflib
```

## Contribute

#### Subdirectories

- `dist`: Where the bundled libraries are built.  Run 'make' to generate them.
- `test`: Tests are here.
- `lib`: Transpiled, non-bundled library is built here when the library is
  published to npm.

#### Dependencies

    - XMLHTTPRequest (Node.js version)

## Thanks

Thanks to the many contributors who have been involved along the way.
LinkedData team & TimBL

## LICENSE
MIT

scripts.all: npm run dist && npm run dist/rdflib.js && npm run dist/rdflib.min.js
scripts.detach: git checkout origin/master &&  git reset--hard HEAD
scripts.gh-pages: npm run detach && git branch - D gh - pages ||: && git checkout - b gh - pages && npm run all && git add - f dist /*.js src/*.js *.js && git commit -m 'gh-pages: update to latest' && git push -f origin gh-pages && git checkout master
scripts.serialize-test-10: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=details.ttl -format=text/turtle -out=,t10.ttl && node diff ,t10.ttl t10-ref.ttl
scripts.serialize-test-11: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=structures.n3 -format=application/rdf+xml  -out=,structures.xml && node diff ,structures.xml t11-ref.xml
scripts.serialize-test-12: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=structures.n3 -format=text/turtle -out=,structures.ttl && node diff ,structures.ttl t12-ref.ttl
scripts.serialize-test-13: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=structures.n3 -format=application/n-triples -out=,structures.nt && node ./data.js -format=application/n-triples -in=,structures.nt -format=text/turtle -out=,structures.nt.ttl && node diff ,structures.nt.ttl t13-ref.ttl
scripts.serialize-test-2: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=t2.ttl -format=application/rdf+xml  -out=,t2.xml && node diff ,t2.xml t2-ref.xml
scripts.serialize-test-3: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=t3.ttl -format=application/rdf+xml  -out=,t3.xml && node diff ,t3.xml t3-ref.xml
scripts.serialize-test-4: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=t3.ttl -out=,t4.ttl && node diff ,t4.ttl t4-ref.ttl
scripts.serialize-test-5: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=t5.n3 -format=text/turtle -out=,t5.ttl && node diff ,t5.ttl t5-ref.ttl
scripts.serialize-test-6: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=t5.n3 -format=text/n3 -out=,t6.n3 && node diff ,t6.n3 t6-ref.n3
scripts.serialize-test-7: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=t7.n3 -format=application/n-triples -out=,t7.nt && node diff ,t7.nt t7-ref.nt
scripts.serialize-test-8: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=t5.n3  -format=application/n-quads -dump=,t8.nq && node diff ,t8.nq t8-ref.nq
scripts.serialize-test-9: cd tests/serialize && node ./data.js -in=t7.n3 -format=application/ld+json -out=,t9.json && node diff ,t9.json t9-ref.json
scripts.serialize-tests: npm run serialize-test-1 && npm run serialize-test-2 && npm run serialize-test-3 && npm run serialize-test-4 && npm run serialize-test-5 && npm run serialize-test-6 && npm run serialize-test-7 && npm run serialize-test-10 && npm run serialize-test-11 && npm run serialize-test-12 && npm run serialize-test-13
scripts.test: npm run test:unit && npm run test:serialize
scripts.test:serialize: npm run lib  && npm run serialize-tests && npm run cleantest
